name: Dusit Thani Hotel

reviews.text: Booked a club room. Was upgraded to a Grand room (junior suite). The room (including bathroom) was fully renovated, and very nice, though you should not expect any special view as the hotel is in the city center.
reviews.title: Excellent
fantastic hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights on route to phuket in early march. We booked through Kuoni. We arrived at 8am and fully expected not to be able to get into to the room but we were pleasantly surprised to find we could. When we got into the room we had been upgraded(perhaps because it had been my husband's birthday). The room was very large and luxurious. The bathroom was enormous and had everything we could possibly want.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were absolutely charming and could not help us enough. On arriving back at the hotel the next day there was a beautiful cake, orchid and card for my husband. We had the included breakfast which was xcellent. We also had afternoon tea whcih was very fancy and great fun.
reviews.title: Only the location saves this hotel

reviews.text: We ate at the thai restaurant- benjarong which was excellent although the wine was too expensive for us.
reviews.title: More than GREAT

reviews.text: There was a beautiful garden in the centre of the hotel but beware there are mosis there and I got badly bitten.
reviews.title: The best hotel ever-like a heaven !!!!!

reviews.text: The doormen were great at calling us cabs and took the numbers which is wise as there are many conmen in Bangkok.
reviews.title: Dusit Thani is a great hotel and I love front reception very much

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Dusit Thani in February 2007. I also stayed at the Westin in March 2007, which I was less impressed by (I have also posted my review on that hotel).
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

likes.liked: — Elegant public areas and restaurants, great gym, great location
likes.disliked: — Room could do with refurb and better bedding

reviews.text: The Dusit Thani was built in the late 60's, but the design has aged well and the premises have been well maintained. It has very spacious public areas and a nice classy elegance. I liked the lobby and courtyard with the waterfall.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, great staff

reviews.text: The pool is not very large, but a pleasant place to relax in busy hectic Bangkok. The gym is very modern, large and well equipped.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants have a lovely decor, the Italian restaurant is very modern and stylish, the Thai restaurant more traditional and opulently elegant. The food we had was perfectly acceptable, but not outstanding.
reviews.title: Love the Dusit!!!!

reviews.text: The room was probably the weakest area. It was pleasant enough, but could do with a refurbishment. There were only bedsheets, whilst I much prefer proper duvets. The bathroom was spacious. elegant and marble-clad, but again there were signs of wear and tear.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: The Dusit Thani is an outdated 4-star hotel masquerading as a classy 5-star hotel. It has a dated 70's appearance on the outside (with a facade of stark materials and sharp angles) and Thai traditional style on the inside (with the furniture bearing ornate wood carvings).
reviews.title: The Dusit Thani's glory years have passed

likes.liked: — The room decor had lots of character
likes.disliked: — The room and service didn't live up to 5-star standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard rooms make the most of a small space, but the bathroom bears the brunt of this economy. It's tiny compared to other hotels in this class, and the door doesn't even clear the bath rug on the floor. The hand-held shower mount is at waist level, too low to be used as a hands-free shower. (A true 5-star hotel should have a separate bath and shower.) Finally, the toilet uses an inconveniently located push button that requires an inordinate amount of force to push and to hold -- and even then, the toilet doesn't flush completely.
reviews.title: Oasis in a city of madness!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other omissions include the lack of an iron and ironing board in the room. There's also no ice bucket (although that means that there is probably also no ice machine; I didn't check). On the plus side, the air conditioning is excellent, complimentary bottles of water are replaced daily, and each room has a balcony that offers a 180-degree view of the Bangkok skyline.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay
Fabulous service, Great location and Excellent Services
reviews.text: My room rate included wired Internet access and breakfast (buffet or table service). The wired Internet service was fast enough, but it logged me out automatically every few hours, even if I was actively using it. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of western and Japanese food, but, surprisingly, no traditional Thai dishes. Some food (such as the sushi) looked old and unappetizing, and on one of my visits, the orange juice dispenser went unfilled during my entire time in the dining room. On another visit, the coffee I was offered never arrived at my table.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the Dusit Thani is unbeatable, with subway and Sky Train connections out front, Lumphini Park across the street, and Patpong around the corner. But given the average quality of the room and the service, the Dusit Thani falls short of what a 5-star luxury hotel experience should be.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: Very nice Hotel, extremly well situated and good value for money,
reviews.title: Lost flair

likes.liked: — the location and value for money paid

reviews.text: but it has lost some of its flair.
reviews.title: Large hotel in great location in Bangkok ... no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at a deluxe room with views to the tiny but cosy swimming pool.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very well located next to the skytrain and underground.
reviews.title: Great Dusit

likes.liked: — Well organised and well presented ;great food great location.
likes.disliked: — Carpet in room a bit grubby looking.

reviews.text: When beeing in bangkok try to avoid the street level in the Sukumvith area as it is crowded and the street is full of loose paviment and wholes.
reviews.title: I keep returning

likes.disliked: — Tired old rooms in old tower

reviews.text: I was here on business for days. We arrived at midnight and they gave us the wrong room, we wanted a 2 bedroom suite with 3 beds and they tried to give us 2 beds. This was corrected. The rooms were clean, beds and pillows comfortable, A/C great. The breakfast buffet will please anyone from any country. I had clothes clean and everything was perfect. There is a skytrain stop next to the hotel. It was quiet and had 24 hr room service. Ate at the Italian restuarant and it was OK, it is thai italan, so spicier. There is free bottled water and a refridgerator full of goodies in the room. There is broad band internet access. There are 18 restaurants in this place, so there are all types of food choices. Overall, a very good experience.
reviews.title: Excellent in the business district

likes.liked: — The breakfast buffet. Nice bathroom too.
likes.disliked: — the hotel is a bit dated

reviews.text: I am not very picky on hotel service, but would like to share my bad experience this time. The first room I checked in, the master light control got some problems and the lights shut off 1-2 mins after I re-inserted my room key, and it happened 5 times. I requested to change a room but hotel insisted they can fix it up. Then they sent someone to check and gave me another card to insert to the light control. I was not really comfortable with the room (it's sacry for a lady when all lights shut down at mid night) and my colleague and I swaped the room.
reviews.title: Bad Service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second day I came back to room, there was water leakage from the ceiling of the bathroom (the house keeper has already place the trash can for the dripped water on the toilet but no message for me whether or not they are going to fix it) I had to call again to see can some one take care of that, and hotel told me they are going to send engineer to my room. I went out to have dinner but when I came back, the trash can was still there and no message to tell me whether they have already checked. Again, they kept saying no room available for change.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Third day when I wanted to have a cup of tea and found there is no tea bags in my room. I asked 3 times to have them send 2 tea bags 2 hours later, when I also fell in sleep.
reviews.title: A majestic old friend in an ideal location

reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel even though the location is very good - to connect to Silom station or Saladaeng station in 3 mins - but there are some other choices in the area.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

description: Ideally located in the heart of Bangkok, known as the 'City of Angels', it sits opposite Lumpini Park with its broad boulevards and expanse of lakes. The luxury hotel is adjacent to both the sky train and subway systems within easy proximity to major business, shopping and entertainment centres.
